p: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle in King County
In the Matter of the Application of Chin Chung (a Chinaman for a writ of Habeas Corpus }
To the Hon. Roger S. Green Chief Justice of Washington Territory and Judge of the above entitled Court.
The petition of Chin Chung respectfully shows:
That he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained and confined and restrained of his liberty, by John H. McGraw Sheriff of the County of King in the Territory of Washington,
That said imprisonment detention, confinement and restraint are illegal; and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to wit:

That on the 11th day of November 1882 at Seattle in said County, before T.H. Cann, Esq., a Justice of the Peace in and for Seattle Precinct in said County a sworn complaint was made by one J.S. Woolery wherein your petitioner was charged with the alleged and pretended crime of "visiting a house kept for the " purpose of opium smoking, " and had in his possession pipes " and appliances for opium smok " ing and did visit such house " or place for the purpose of smok " ing or inhaling opium;" that upon such complaint a warrant was issued by said Justice of the Peace, upon which warrant your petitioner was arrested and brought before said Justice of the Peace; that there after such proceedings were had that on the 17h day of November 1882 your petitioner was tried before said Justice of the Peace for said alleged offense
and upon said trial was found guilty of said alleged offense and was by the judgement of Justices Court sentenced to pay a fine of twenty five dollars
and in default of such payment to be committed to the County Jail of said County

that your petitioner failing to pay said fine was has been by said Court committed to said Jail, and now stands committed as aforesaid to said jail, and is in the custody of said Sheriff at said Seattle, and is restrained of his liberty as aforesaid; that said trial and commandment as aforesaid were had under and by virtue of section 2073 of the Cody of Washington; that said section is unconstitutional and void, and that said arrest, commitment and trail are therefore without any authority of law.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted, directed to the said John H. McGraw, Sheriff of said King County, commanding him to have the body said Chin Chung before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then be and there be considered by your Honor concerning him, together with the time of cause of his detention, and said writ; and that he may be restored to his liberty
Date on the 18th day of November 1882
Chin Chung by J.C. Haines his Attorney
